semantic_title: Documentation of Ventilator Associated Pneumonia Coding Requirements
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 10. Chapter 10: Diseases of the Respiratory System > d. Ventilator associated Pneumonia > 1. Documentation of Ventilator associated Pneumonia

content.full_text: As with all procedural or postprocedural complications, code assignment is based on the provider's documentation of the relationship between the condition and the procedure. Code J95.851, Ventilator associated pneumonia, should be assigned only when the provider has documented ventilator associated pneumonia (VAP). An additional code to identify the organism (e.g., Pseudomonas aeruginosa, code B96.5) should also be assigned. Do not assign an additional code from categories J12-J18 to identify the type of pneumonia. Code J95.851 should not be assigned for cases where the patient has pneumonia and is on a mechanical ventilator and the provider has not specifically stated that the pneumonia is ventilator-associated pneumonia. If the documentation is unclear as to whether the patient has a pneumonia that is a complication attributable to the mechanical ventilator, query the provider. (Evidence: pg no: 57, L80-L83)
content.summary: Specific documentation requirements for coding ventilator associated pneumonia including provider statement requirements, organism coding, and query guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 57, L80-L83)
key_concepts: Provider documentation requirement (Evidence: pg no: 57, L80-L81)
Specific VAP terminology requirement (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81)
Organism identification coding (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81)
Exclusion of pneumonia type codes (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81-L82)
Provider query requirement (Evidence: pg no: 57, L83)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code J95.851 should be assigned only when provider has documented ventilator associated pneumonia (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81)
detailed_rules.explanation: Specific provider documentation of VAP relationship is required, not just presence of pneumonia in ventilated patient (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81)

detailed_rules.rule_text: An additional code to identify the organism should also be assigned (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81)
detailed_rules.explanation: When VAP is coded, the causative organism must be identified with additional code when known (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign additional code from categories J12-J18 to identify type of pneumonia (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81-L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: VAP code J95.851 is sufficient for pneumonia type identification, additional pneumonia codes are not needed (Evidence: pg no: 57, L81-L82)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Do not assign J95.851 when patient has pneumonia and is on mechanical ventilator without specific VAP documentation (Evidence: pg no: 57, L82)
detailed_rules.explanation: Presence of pneumonia in mechanically ventilated patient does not automatically qualify as VAP without provider documentation (Evidence: pg no: 57, L82)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If documentation is unclear about pneumonia being ventilator-attributable complication, query the provider (Evidence: pg no: 57, L83)
detailed_rules.explanation: When relationship between pneumonia and ventilator is unclear, provider clarification is required (Evidence: pg no: 57, L83)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Identify pneumonia diagnosis in ventilated patient
Step 2: Look for specific VAP documentation by provider
Step 3: If VAP documented, assign J95.851
Step 4: Identify and code causative organism
Step 5: Do not add J12-J18 codes
Step 6: If unclear, query provider for clarification
